programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 5 The MP Émilise Lessard-Therrien is Quebec's first elected representative to take her baby into a parliamentary session. Guillaume Cantin has created the Transformerie, to reduce food waste. Brigitte Alepin is working for a fairer tax system; Sévrine Labelle, for the right to disconnect. Manon Jean expresses emotions using meteorological vocabulary. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc:
Romania: between East and West, on the threshold of the war
Member of NATO since 2004 and the European Union since 2077, Russia's invasion of Ukraine has made Romania a country of strategic importance. Outpost of western aid, fallback position for Ukrainian refugees and on the front line with Moldavia, Romania lives in fear of an extension of the war.
Presented by: Émilie Aubry.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Season: 2021

Greater Pithiverais

At the Domaine de Faronville we catch up with Pauline and Paul-Henry between harvesting potatoes and distilling spirits, before discovering a farm where storytelling brings a unique rhythm to harvest-time. Professional integration and market gardening make perfect partners at the Jardins de la Voie Romaine. All about Pithiviers' gingerbread.

Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Le vrai nouveau monde
programme.desc: All is possible Gregory Charles meets the police chief of Longueuil, on the outskirts of Montreal. Born in Côte d'Ivoire to Lebanese parents, Fady Dagher arrived in Quebec as a student at the age of 17. A very different story to that of Cynthia Rodriguez, who had only recently decided to leave Venezuela. Directed by: Sophie Lambert (Canada, 2019) With Gregory Charles

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: The Corsica of Guy de Maupassant With its villages clinging to vertiginous hillsides and its nature in a thousand different colours, Corsica dazzled Guy de Maupassant. After his first literary successes, Corsica appeared to the young Maupassant as the most exotic of destinations: totally wild. An island that inspired several of his short stories.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Pancakes galore
Did pancakes originate in Brittany? What's the difference between a "crêpe" and a "galette"? And how did they become emblematic of Candlemas? Jamy recounts the history of the pancake and shares the technique that will ensure you make perfect pancakes every time!
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
The Revolutions of 1848/October 1860, sack of the Summer Palace in Beijing
1848 isn't so much a date as a vintage, a year that concerned the whole of Europe, laying the foundations of its political modernity. October 1860, English and French troops pillaged and destroyed Qing Xianfeng's summer palace: the Yuánmíng Yuán. The episode marked the climax of the Second Opium War.
Directed by: Pascal Goblot, Juliette Garcias (France, 2019-220)

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Pornic, with Nicoletta
Mory Sacko is in Pornic, in the Loire-Atlantique. He'll be giving a new twist to a regional product, cuttlefish, using the ink to prepare arancini. And to offer a welcome helping hand, the singer Nicoletta.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Pancakes galore
Did pancakes originate in Brittany? What's the difference between a "crêpe" and a "galette"? And how did they become emblematic of Candlemas? Jamy recounts the history of the pancake and shares the technique that will ensure you make perfect pancakes every time!
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Les petites bulles
programme.desc: Nature walk Children don't always appreciate going for a walk. But they were delighted to follow Laurent Burgisser, biologist and ethnobotanist, equipped with his bag full of little secrets...

programme.title: Les contes de Lupin
programme.sub-title: Le basilic et le bouclier de porcelaine

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
Young singers
Océana, who won 2020 The Voice Kids (Belgium), has come to perform her new single in the studio. Rocky and Lily make the most of the moment to interview her and learn more about other singers of her age.
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Pornic, with Nicoletta
Mory Sacko is in Pornic, in the Loire-Atlantique. He'll be giving a new twist to a regional product, cuttlefish, using the ink to prepare arancini. And to offer a welcome helping hand, the singer Nicoletta.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Dropping anchor in Madeira Madeira, an archipelago covering some 740km² in the Atlantic Ocean. Its discovery in 1418 marked a turning point in Portuguese history because, for the first time, its caravels didn't follow the African coast. Today, Madeira remains an island out of time, between sea and mountain, perfect for rest and relaxation. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard. Directed by: Pascal André Villa (season 15, France, 2021)

programme.title: Entre les vagues
programme.desc:
Margaux and Alma share a love of the theatre. Although sometimes finding themselves competing for a role, they remain best friends. Despite everything, they make progress and seem unstoppable. Alma and  Margot's relationship really is ''for better and for worse''.

Directed by: Anaïs Volpé (France, 2021)

Cast: Entre les vagues

Awards: Official selection (Directors' Fortnight, Cannes 2021 ; FIFF Angoulême 2021)

Genre: Drama

programme.title: Boomerang
programme.desc:
Episode 10: By the skin of his teeth

Karine is very anxious about leaving Alexandra at the crèche for the first time. Patrick has technical problems to overcome for the opening of his restaurant. As he calls on the whole family for help, he learns that an inspector is about to call.

Directed by: Charles-Olivier Michaud (season 5, Canada, 2019)

Screenplay: Yann Tanguay

Cast: Catherine-Anne Toupin (Karine), Antoine Bertrand (Patrick), Marie-Thérèse Fortin (Monique), Marc Messier (Pierre), Magalie Lépine-Blondeau (Stéphanie), Fabien Cloutier (Sylvain), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Richard), Annabelle Guérin (Jeanne), Diane Lavallée (Sylvie)

Genre: comedy drama
